doc:
Jean Shepherd https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Shepherd 0 Jean Parker Shepherd, Jr. (July 26, 1921 – October 16, 1999) was an American storyteller, radio and TV personality, writer and actor. He was often referred to by the nickname Shep. With a career that spanned decades, Shepherd is known to modern audiences for the film A Christmas Story (1983), which he narrated and co-scripted, based on his own semi-autobiographical stories. Jean_Parker_Shepherd , Jr. ( July_26_,_1921 – October_16_,_1999 ) was an_American_storyteller_,_radio_and_TV_personality , writer_and_actor . He was_often_referred to by the_nickname Shep . With a_career that spanned decades , Shepherd is_known to modern_audiences for the_film A_Christmas_Story ( 1983 ) , which he narrated_and_co-scripted , based on his_own_semi-autobiographical_stories .
